title: 6 Minute Walk Distance
description: Calculates reference values for walk distance as a measure of functional status in cardiopulmonary diseases

ranges.interpretation: Distance much lower than expected. Indicates severe functional limitation requiring intensive investigation and treatment.
Distance lower than expected. Suggests moderate functional limitation that may benefit from rehabilitation.
Distance slightly lower than expected. May indicate mild functional limitation or onset of decline.
Distance within expected values for age, sex, height, and weight. Indicates preserved functional capacity.

references: Enright PL, Sherrill DL. Reference equations for the six-minute walk in healthy adults. Am J Respir Crit Care Med. 1998;158(5 Pt 1):1384-7.
ATS Committee on Proficiency Standards for Clinical Pulmonary Function Laboratories. ATS statement: guidelines for the six-minute walk test. Am J Respir Crit Care Med. 2002;166(1):111-7.
Casanova C, Celli BR, Barria P, et al. The 6-min walk distance in healthy subjects: reference standards from seven countries. Eur Respir J. 2011;37(1):150-6.
formula: Men: 6MWD = (7.57 × height_cm) - (5.02 × age) - (1.76 × weight_kg) - 309. Women: 6MWD = (2.11 × height_cm) - (2.29 × weight_kg) - (5.78 × age) + 667
notes: Apply to healthy adults aged 40-80 years (Enright-Sherrill equations)
Lower limit of normality = predicted value - 153 meters
Learning effect exists: average 15% improvement when repeated
Simple, inexpensive, and non-invasive test to assess functional capacity
Useful in heart failure, COPD, pulmonary hypertension, and other conditions
Not diagnostic alone - should accompany other tests
Normal values generally between 400-700 meters in healthy adults
